reviews.review_msg: A crap show. Midterm was full of typos, trick questions and so was the final. Don't even listen to his lectures, just read the textbook. The class average was crap. If you can avoid him, please do. One review said "he is not as bad as ppl think" - he is. I listened to that comment and I took 201 with him. Biggest mistake.
Rose was just the rudest prof I've ever had. So disrespectful when it came to students. Not only that but he failed to tell the entire class the same information.

If you have a good TA, you will do fine in this class. I liked Gordon up until his final exam which was 60 minutes for 60 questions and was HARD (the average was 59%). He also told students he would scale the class, and ended up not scaling at all. Thank goodness for students who pressured him into making the exam 20% because it was originally 40%

Gordon is a weird one. His lectures are so intense with information it is honestly overwhelming. He gives thorough lectures but a lot of the time the information goes over everyone's heads. A big thing with him is that he doesn't care about his students, he never taught me anything I learned this entire course through my TA. Avoid if you can.

well educated but monotone while speaking. he has a very mean vibe to him. you need to go to all the lectures in order to do well on the quizes (did i mention there is one every single class?). you need to know content from both lectures and the textbook (posts his lecture slides online though). overall not horrible, but not engaging at all
Content is not too difficult because its project based. I've got a good TA so its fine  BUT the lecture is terribly boring and useless.
No Comments

For me, he is the best prof in SFU so far.He is very organize, his lecture is very clear, all multiple choices exam. He is a fair marker, not so hard if u follow everything. However, the research paper is not so easy.
I think he was pretty good... made me more interested and i don't believe i fell asleep in  lecture (might have... but don't think so)

Guy is completely average in every way. His teaching really has no effect on how well you do in the course. Midterm and the final are both multiple choice; if you can't get an A or a B on a MC test, then you probably don't know how to study properly. Ace both tests and don't mess up your project.

I honestly don't understand why people have such problems with him. I found his lectures to be really easy to follow and very clear. His tests were from his lectures so if you study his notes you'll be fine. He's a good teacher.

Very big ego. Organized, but dull and boring material presented in a dull and boring way. If it weren't for some interesting case studies reviewed during class entire course would have been unbearably awful.

His writing is illegible!
 He speaks well and that's really all you can go on.
 
 He talks about a lot of useless things that are not even on the exam. He goes beyond the class requirement, which is usually a good thing but he does it in such a manner that the material confuses you even more.
 
 His exams are difficult. You must read the questions

He lectures well but his writing is terrible. We spent  much time on things not important and no time on the important, exam staff. The exams are level 300, very difficult. He gives scenarios that u have to read few times to understand. Also, he focused on areas that are studied in another class. I would not take another class with him.

Very difficult prof. Stay away from him unless you need a challenge! Does not use the textbook, no overheads, talks way too fast, and hard hard exams! Psyc201 was waay too statistical, should be intro to methods, not stats!
typicall psyc prof ...he is nice though
i got killed by the final..
Occasional overhead notes,illegible writing,knows his material,sometimes funny
CRANKY, ok-hard tests, talks fast, writes bad, tells good jokes, knows his stuff

Kevin is an awesome professor. Went through information so clearly and slowly making a seemlingly unteeresting class my favorite one this semester. Oh, and he's so sexy that even if the class was boring, it would still be enjoyable to go to!! :)
A very good prof - encourages and answers questions. Gives great examples/case studies.The course itself is a bit dry and boring.

Most students did not attend lecture whatsoever because honestly, you're better off just staying at home, reading the textbook, and teaching yourself all the material. He seems like a very nice person, but attending lectures is completely useless because he reads straight off the slides anyways.
The absolute coolest. Take him if you get the chance.

I took Psyc 201W in Spring 2025. His lectures and slides were super clear. The weekly quizzes were online and extremely easy. For the paper, make sure to do lots of research and attend the tutorial. TAs are the ones who mark the paper and they give lots of feedback. Ric is a super caring and accommodating prof! Final exam was easy.

An okay class, I skipped most of his lectures since I found them a bit boring, but he's very passionate about psychology. This class consists of putting together a final research project + research paper to hand in at the end. Be sure to attend tutorials and ask for feedback (for your rough drafts) since that's where most of our grade comes from

I took psyc 201W with him fall 2024, his lectures and slides were clear especially if you also read the textbook. Weekly quizzes were super easy and online, papers are too if you do your research and go to tutorial. If you do well on the quizzes and keep up with the lectures you will get a good grade. Super caring, taking another class with him rn!

Good professor, straightforward style, nice powerpoints.  The course content is too basic though.  My cousin is in grade 3 and she knows at least half the concepts for doing scientific experiments taught in this course.  The experiment you get to do by yourself is cool though.

Lecture was soooooo boring. OMG. i stopped going in the third week.  textbook is a must - all the material is relevant. Exam wording is tricky, you need to be very careful. Online study guide was helpful.

Jodi is an excellent prof. Her exams are not easy, but they are fair as she prepares you for them extensively with very organized notes and     informative lectures. Labs are VERY useful, and mandatory for a good grade. If you want a great prof, an informative class, and a good experience, take 201 with Jodi. P.S Kallista is the best TA ever!!!

Great prof! Really knows how to explain the material in a way so that students will remember and understand it. Highly organized notes and references the text. Exams are very fair, though you do need to study! She went the extra mile due to a snow day and gave an extension on the essay and reduced the exam. Good communication via email. TAKE HER!

OMG A prof that uses the textbook!  All the material is pretty much straight from the text, and there is an online study guide thing (although not very good).  I found that what we needed to know was clearly laid out for us so it was easy to do well on the exam if you read the chapters and put some effort into making sure you knew it.
The exam is difficult. :(
Excellent TA, knows his stuff, makes attending tutorial interesting, is a fair marker, and is always available to help you.  Likes to drink beer at the pub.

probably the worst prof i have ever had. She is so rude and gives attitude, you would never expect that from a prof. course material is is not dependent on teaching style significantly, but Jamal's attitude made it hell. I would not recommend her to anyone, after an incident that happened i had written her up and told i was not th first to complain
I don't know why everyone's complaining. I thought she was a good prof. I was really stressing about this class but I studied from the textbook and received an A+! Definite GPA booster.

She is knowledgable about the subject,but doesn't not how to convey it to students.When one doesn't understand smtght,she'll reexplain it in the same manner as the 1st time.So unless u got it on the spot,u won't get it!She is PICKY abt late assignmts/forgotten sheets (e.g grading rubric).Assignmts take time to do,and most aren't worth it mark-wise.

The course material is somewhat dry, but she made it interesting and her lectures were  enjoyable. The marking and tests were fair overall, but the tests were based around concepts, so don't just memorize definitions. I also found that she was extremely helpful and friendly when I went to her office hours.
The prof is good, she has definitely improved. Her explanation is clear and she is here to help you. Plus, she is friendly.

The prof is one of the better ones I've had so far. She seems to be quite passionate and open-minded. The course was quite interesting and Jamal threw in a handful of jokes at times. The marking was fair, I think, though I found the exams extremely difficult. Don't study definitions. Instead, make sure you understand the content.
Tried to make the bland topics fun.  Easy to listen to her talk because she's usually energetic.  Seemed to be interested in what she was teaching.
I agree that he's hard, not helpful and unclear, but if you read the textbook, you will do very well like a B or something.  I know it sounds strange but that's true.

The lectures get really difficult towards the end and he has set the final exam and the project on the same day Im probably going to have to cry myself to finish the work. Thats 70% of the grade all in the same day. He also never shows you any of the exams so you dont know where you went wrong Take this class at sfu He is nice tho

Not a great option to take his class. He never goes into detail about what he wants from students; just really vague instructions. Also, only like 10% of the class can get an A so most of us aware pretty much screwed.

He's quite sensitive and he gets very irritated when a student tries to ask him a question. He rambles so much in classes. His 2 hour classes can easily be condensed into 40 minutes. He can never stay focused on one topic. He constantly jumps around. He is a nice guy and it is very easy to talk to him but he's really flighty and unfocused.
Owen is always being happy and patient to help students to succeed. He gives much effective advice for the research project and helpful feedback, which helps a lot for the psychology career

Especially bad teacher, work efficiency is very low, paper must always ask him to tell you the problem, only say one at a time, the next time ask him to tell you the next problem. The material in class is not very useful for the exam, if you want to pass it, you can only read books. A lazy teacher.

He cracks some jokes about football and hates when you're late, so try not to do that. Overall not bad. The biggest part of this course is the research project worth 40%, and the worst part about it is there are lots of stipulations - you can't pick any experiment you want. Kind of limiting. Lectures are pretty chill, though. Read the textbook.

Do not choose his course.  He has no respect to students at all. Worst professor I have ever met so far.  You have to beg for his help or he will never help. Poor attitudes and he has really low EQ, very easy to be pissed off. Lectures notes are not useful as the textbook. Read the text in very detail then u will pass this course.

Really nice prof!! He was willing to help students who struggled with their research papers, and even gave extra assistance to students whose first language is not English!! Patient and gave useful feedback.
The course is not easy. U have to create an experiment and write a big paper on it. The exams are hard as well.

Good lecturer as he is very clear and he makes sure you understand the material. But can be repetitive. Made it quite interesting. Exams are hard if you don't study the text and the notes but it isn't hard to do well. Coming up with a topic for the paper was difficult. My advice: be as specific as you can or your topic will be rejected.

The course itself was average, put in time youll do fine. You have to conduct, present and submit a psyc research study. Apart from the class, this guy is a jerk, I really don't know what his problem is. Hes so paranoid that people will cheat in his class that he takes ridiculous measures during exams. One of the only classes Ive dreaded so much.

Class is mandatory, doesn't post notes or use webct. Posts grades in office. Said final exam was cumulative but only few pre-midterm questions. Don?t wear hats, sweatshirts or long sleeves to his exams because he will make you take your clothes off and write the exam in your underwear. He?s fishy. How well you do on final project depends on TA.

his exams are irrelevant to his lectures but really easy. I got 54/60 and DID NOT attend his lectures once. The only reason people are doing so bad in this class is that you'll have to write a research paper with no specific instructions or guidelines. no wonder the class average is so low. IF WRITING IS NOT YOUR THING, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS.

Everyone did well on the exam, and since it's curved, doesn't mean much. Boring, monotone, and repeats the same information that we already knew from previous chapters. I don't understand why we review the same stuff over and over. Arrogant when answering questions
He's really willing to help students when they ask for help. Very clear. Lectures are very well organized. Wish he taught some of the upper level courses, but sadly I don't think he does.. :(

Dont bother following the text reading list, material is presented all over the place. Exams dont consist of any eg he presents in lecture. You can get away self-teaching by reading the text, lec attendance is a waste. Kind of jerk when u ask a question. Will patronize u in front of class. Unorganized and technologically incompetent.

Speaks ridiculously slowly and is unbelievably boring to listen to. Doesn't use WebCT, so you get a bunch of handouts or emails that only reach half the class because of inadequate email lists. Gives short notice about written assignment. Exams are easy.

Good to know I wasn't the only one with a secret crush on him! He definitely wants every student to do their best. He's always in a pleasant mood and doesn't mind repeating things that weren't made clear enough the first time. If you can, take a course with Owen. He's a great prof!

Awesome professor! I wasn't initially interested in or excited about taking this course, but he made it a pleasure. Takes his time explaining concepts, and encourages questions. Also, really seems like he cares about the students and our success in the course. Highly recommended - he's cute too!

Not a very good prof. He doesn't convey information to students clearly. He is quiet, slow and plus very monotone in his lectures. He did provide a lot of examples which is great but it's hard to concentrate in his class. I would avoid taking a class with him in the future.
The material is fairly boring, but it is a methods course! I enjoyed the lectures for the most part. Sometimes a little dry but not the profs fault. good prof.

Ric is a really kind prof who cares about you doing well. His lectures are not always that interesting, but the class is not that difficult. The only hard part was the terrible TA who had no idea what he was doing and could never answer any questions. There are several smaller assignments that fit together to become a research project.

I took psyc 201W with him fall 2024, his lectures and slides were clear especially if you also read the textbook. Weekly quizzes were super easy and online, papers are too if you do your research and go to tutorial. If you do well on the quizzes and keep up with the lectures you will get a good grade. Super caring, taking another class with him rn

Second time shes been my prof and shes great! Lectures are boring but shes willing to meet and explain concepts in office hours, as well as provides time to go over the projects. Multiple choice quiz every other week, as long as you study the questions in the textbook and lecture slides you'll be fine. make sure to be able to apply the concepts!
so considerate and reasonable, one of those profs that explains things in amazing ways, highly reccommend!

One of the better TA's you're likely to find, no matter the discipline.  Very passionate about the course material, despite it's being technical and thick.  Great sense of humour.  Honest (and thus tough) marker!  But at the same time gracious if you have extenuating circumstances and need extensions.  Highly recommended!
Awesome TA.
Awesome Ta!

Extremely helpful.  Goes out of her way to make tutorials interesting and exciting.  Always on hand to give advice, and would schedule advising times outside of office hours.  Overall, an enthusiastic, fun and professional individual.
